justification: The study measured participants' confidence using a scale ranging from 1 to 6 where participants rated their confidence after making a decision. This is visible in the Methods section where it is explained how participants rated their confidence on a Likert scale ranging from 'completely unsure' to 'absolute certainty'.

measured_by: Random starting points on the confidence scale
justification: The anchoring effect was manipulated by varying the starting point of the confidence marker on the Likert scale. The starting point was randomized across trials, enabling the measurement of how this arbitrary starting point influenced participants' confidence judgments.
